posts.post_content:
Hmmm wonder why this (currently) is rated lower than Venser.  
  
Anyways, many people say that Koth can't protect himself, so he is bad. What people are forgetting is that Koth is a red walker. He does not need to protect himself, he just needs to dish out as much damage as possible.  
  
Whether he's acting as a constantly recurring [Vengevine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vengevine), or leveling up a [Kargan Dragonlord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kargan Dragonlord) all the way in one turn, the fits like a glove into most mono red strategies.  
  
And his ultimate pretty much wins the game. That always helps.
posts.html:
Hmmm wonder why this (currently) is rated lower than Venser.

Anyways, many people say that Koth can't protect himself, so he is bad. What people are forgetting is that Koth is a red walker. He does not need to protect himself, he just needs to dish out as much damage as possible.

Whether he's acting as a constantly recurring Vengevine, or leveling up a Kargan Dragonlord all the way in one turn, the fits like a glove into most mono red strategies.

And his ultimate pretty much wins the game. That always helps.

Posted By: faisjdas (9/23/2010 8:49:00 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Very Straightforward abilities, especially the first one, consider you do untap an mountain, which means you can get an extra red mana in that turn, or you can use it as a 4/4 to dish out 4 damage.
  
   
Ultimately, he makes your mountains into pyromancers that can't be dealt damage by red or white/black removal. After all that been said, everyone here agrees the 'Fury' awesomeness he represent.
  
   
After reading the comcs, this guy is patient and resolute to execute his plans to destroy your opponents while Chandra on the other hand prefer to hit it head on.
  
   
Bet most of us here want to see Glissa from the next expansion, after all, she is a planeswalker. Too bad Slobad died in the last encounter.

After reading the comcs, this guy is patient and resolute to execute his plans to destroy your opponents while Chandra on the other hand prefer to hit it head on.

Bet most of us here want to see Glissa from the next expansion, after all, she is a planeswalker. Too bad Slobad died in the last encounter.

posts.post_content:
@SorianSadaskan, Did you even read the books? SPOILER ALERT- *The Glissa fell into the magma and died, taking Memnarch with her, the machine he had built did what it was meant to do, but with no one els alive in there the spark went to Slobad, he however, didn't want it, so he released the spark and everyone who died to channel it into him was brought back to life, Glissa and Slobad both lived, but there was no spark.* -SPOILER END So i doubt we will be seeing a planeswalker Glissa.

posts.post_content:
@SlickDragon, I agree Jace is better. No question. But cloneeffect was saying how Koth is format changing..not better. I can't agree or disagree yet, but I can see where he's coming from. You always have to fear a topdecking red deck when your life is low...well, with Koth, "low" means around 10. I already used red in standard...and now a buttload more people will. It's hard to say how well it'll do, but...I think people may fear Koth more than Jace in standard...Jace has awesome combos, Koth kills. I still definatly fear both, but in standard alone? Koth just *might* pull out a win. extended and back? Jace all the way.  
  
...and even if it turns out to be not true...keep saying it! Maybe Jace's price will go down! lol

posts.post_content:
Turn 4 Koth, turn 5 kozilek, turn 6 destructive force? That seems...good. Leaves with some enormous eldrazi and Koth. And the other guy has no land. And you can bash for 4 with any remaining land you have!  
  
There's a bunch of insane abilities right there...obviously you can never let Koth go ultimate. And you can never not have an answer when he uses his minus 2. And the plus 1 is plain annoying. People seem to be missing the point with the +1 - "oh noooes, you might loose a land!". Dude, why the heck are they going to be killing your manland rather than Koth himself - if they do that, they probably just lost the game right there? The mana acceleration is so incredible - oh, have I mentioned Kargan Dragonlord yet? - that this could potentially see Celestial Purge getting maindecked in the venser/elspeth blue-white decks. In fact he's potentially more format-warping (in standard, obviously) than Jace TMS, because although he goes into fewer decks - far fewer decks - his sheer bomb facto...
